sub_topic: Finding the perimeter of a circle.
message_1: What is the perimeter of a circle with a radius of 8 cm? (Round your answer to the nearest hundredth.)
message_2:
The perimeter of a circle, also known as the circumference, can be calculated using the formula C = 2πr, where C is the circumference and r is the radius.

In this case, the radius (r) is 8 cm. So, we can plug this value into the formula:

C = 2π(8)

C ≈ 2 × 3.14 × 8

C ≈ 6.28 × 8

C ≈ 50.24

Therefore, the perimeter (circumference) of the circle is approximately 50.24 cm.
